main event: A military observer at Columbus AFB in Mississippi saw a bright, round object that appeared to be standing still for a few seconds before moving at high speed towards the south on December 19, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as a round, pale blue light about 7 feet in diameter that seemed unlike any aircraft the observer was familiar with.
The object moved at an estimated speed of 500-700 mph and was visible for 15-20 seconds.
The observer was an experienced air traffic controller who had served for almost 15 years, adding credibility to the sighting.
Other military personnel also reported seeing similar unidentified objects in the area around Columbus AFB in 1946-1948.
The observer compared the object's appearance and movement to an ICBM missile re-entering the atmosphere with a comet-like trail and fiery nose.
sighted object: a bright, round, pale blue light about 7 feet in diameter
